title: Pima County wants to limit heavy trucks on dirt roads
excerpt: Huge mine trucks and other heavy trucks may soon face strict limits on how many can travel and how fast they can travel on dirt roads in unincorporated Pima County.
body: County leaders are considering stricter rules for large trucks on dirt roads to reduce dust and improve safety.
The proposal would set limits on traffic volume and speed in sensitive areas.
SSSR supports measures that protect public health and minimize impacts to nearby neighborhoods.
